directions: For pork: Preheat oven to 350°F. In small bowl, mix paprika, black pepper, salt, chili powder, sugar, and cayenne. Rub both sides of each tenderloin piece with spice mixture. Preheat oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat and pan-sear pieces until golden brown on both sides. Transfer to oven until done (6 to 8 minutes for each inch of thickness).
To make pico de gallo, mix all ingredients. Serve 1/2 cup over tenderloin.
ingredients: 24 oz pork tenderloin, trimmed, cut into 3- to 4-oz pieces
title: Adobo-Rubbed Pork Tenderloin with Black Bean Pico de Gallo
